Configuration.StudyNameEntrez: Biology and Molecular Analysis of Human Hematopoiesis Genetics
Configuration.StudyNameReportPage: Biology and Molecular Analysis of Human Hematopoiesis Genetics
Configuration.Description: In this study we have performed exome sequencing using the hybrid capture method that has previously been described (Gnirke et al., Nature Biotechnology, 2009) on genomic DNA samples from patients with the congenital bone marrow failure syndrome that affects the erythroid lineage, specifically, Diamond-Blackfan anemia. This disease is characterized by a hypoplastic anemia and approximately 50% of cases are attributable to mutations in ribosomal protein gene subunits. The other 50% of cases do not have a known genetic etiology and the purpose of this study is to attempt to delineate such causes.
Configuration.StudyInEx: We have selected probands with Diamond-Blackfan anemia diagnosed based upon clinical and laboratory criteria and have excluded patients with known genetic mutations. Details of this cohort that was used in this study have been described in prior publications (Gazda et al., Am J Hum Genet, 2008).
